transportAdvice: Windhoek has a limited public minibus network that primarily serves local commuters and does not reliably cover most tourist areas, so renting a car or using metered taxis is the most practical option for visitors; the compact city centre is walkable during daylight hours but taxis are recommended after dark.

weather.description: Peak rainy season with warm temperatures and frequent afternoon thunderstorms.
Continued wet season with heavy showers and lush green surroundings.
Rain begins to ease slightly but afternoons remain stormy and warm.
Transitional month with decreasing rainfall and pleasantly warm days.
Dry season begins with clear skies, warm days, and cool nights.
Cool and dry winter month with crisp mornings and sunny afternoons.
Driest and coolest month of the year with cold nights and clear blue skies.
Still dry with warming days and cold mornings as winter begins to ease.
Spring arrives with hot sunny days and very little chance of rain.
Hot and dry with occasional early-season clouds building in the afternoons.
Pre-rainy season heat with increasing humidity and the first scattered thunderstorms.
Rainy season returns with hot temperatures and regular afternoon downpours.
